lead_paragraph: Statements during jury selection for the trial of Officer Peter Liang, who shot an unarmed man in a housing project, point to the public debate after several high-profile killings by the police.

headline.print_headline: Officer’s Trial Over Killing Shows Divide Among Public
headline.main: Public Divide on Police Hangs Over Brooklyn Officer’s Manslaughter Trial

snippet: Statements during jury selection for the trial of Officer Peter Liang, who shot an unarmed man in a housing project, point to the public debate after several high-profile killings by the police.
abstract: Opening statements in manslaughter trial of New York City Police Officer Peter Liang will begin in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn; Lian is charged in 2014 fatal shooting of Akai Gurley, unarmed black man, in stairwell of Brooklyn housing project; trial will likely hinge on whether jurors in case believe unusual criminal charge against police officer is warranted, verdict potentially impacted by string of high-profile deaths of unarmed black men involving police officers.
